channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge pothole - you filled the wrong one!!, 10th September
item.description:
You filled one of the potholes but not the largest which is full of water and all cars drive through it and soak the house. Having a new front door fitted today as the old one completely ruined by this. I’m so unhappy with how this issue is being disregarded. Please return and fill the big pothole and also address the fact the storm drains are completely blocked causing natural springs to pop up on the road. Patching will not sort the underlying drainage issue. We cannot get to our house without crossing a slippy and slimy road?! This has been going on for over two years and I’m now seeking legal advice due to the damage caused to our house and will be making a claim if this is not sorted once and for all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement exactly outside 57 Naunton Way, 10th September
item.description:
During raining, always has water rushes out from the water meter cover. Reported to STW, and they confirmed it is not any leaking in their meters or pipe. This has happened only when heavy rain, and it has significantly affected the children crossing the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Emmanuel Gardens, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights not staying on green long enough causing huge tail back, 10th September
item.description:
Long tail backs towards Gloucester are being caused by these traffic lights not staying green long enough. There is hardly any traffic on the other side of the lights. This seems to be at rush hour period from 4pm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Graffiti, 9th September
item.description:
Some chap is camping in the lay-by and has painted all the boards that are hiding a derelict site. His van is there permanently, has an armchair on the street and paints the boards constantly. It seems harmless but it’s not what we want/expect our neighbourhood to look like.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: No dog waste bins available, 9th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Hucclecote Road, Brockworth, Gloucester

item.title: Gulley blocked., 9th September
item.description:
Subway at Elmbridge Court under A417 and A40 Golden Valley bypass. Blocked gulley , Cheltenham Road end , fly tipping on up ramp , excess weeds and other vegetation in subway under A40 section. Both need cleaning because of the link to the £48 Million flagship cycle spine that joins Gloucester City to Cheltenham Town ?????
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DANGER to public. Broken fence with exposed barbed wire, next to public path., 9th September
item.description:
Small grassed area on A345 near roundabout that turns to Sapphire Road. The wooden fence (serves no purpose) is broken in several places with exposed sharps and exposed barbed wire.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Cherry Blossom Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 9th September
item.description:
Hi, the drain opposite to 90 Pennine Road. They seem to clear the opposite one in the roundabout but not the other side. Everytime heavy rainfall the roundabout is flooding and rising more each time. I believe it hasn’t been cleaned out in years. I’m not sure if they are aware there are two drains in the roundabout road. I have lived here 4 years and it’s been hapoening
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Pennine Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car driving over kerb and causing damage to verge, especially when wet weather arrives. I have reported this before . Located at 5 Howards place. Not sure if they had planning permission to turn front garden in to a car park., 9th September
item.description:
Problem at 5 Howard’s Place, Hucclecote rd Damage to verge due to their car driving over verge to access their garden.in the winter months the mud from the wheels cover the footpath in front of their property

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
